forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 53. West wind around 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

forecast.name: Independence Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 18 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day begins under a mixed canvas of clouds and sunny patches, a curtain gently lifted to reveal glimpses of the beloved skyline. A brisk west wind propels the air, weaving through avenues and along the waterfront at a steady pace. This combined tempo of coolness and clarity suggests a lively morning awash in muted colors, a gentle wake-up call for the city’s early risers. As the sun bows gracefully toward its zenith, the forecast promises a high of 62, sliding gracefully into a refreshing coolness by afternoon.

Currently, a marine layer sprawls insidiously across the bay, softening the horizon but allowing enough sunlight to break through. It hints at a misty charm—like a whisper from the ocean—while ridding the air of stifling heat. Those venturing outdoors today may find comfort in layers; a light sweater or jacket will serve well against the gusty winds, perfect companions in a landscape wherein the cool freshness invigorates your spirit. Plan your day thoughtfully—perhaps a stroll through the Mission District to enjoy street art and local coffee or a quiet sit at a café along the Embarcadero, watching the ripples glide by under the shimmering light. Each activity beckons with the promise of serenity beneath the expansive sky.
